summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding press guidance for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses logistics for opening statements, witness anonymity, and the charges Maxwell faces for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and traffic minors.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: SDNY press office staff member coordinating press guidance and courtroom seating for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Janis Echenberg
persons.context: SDNY staff member involved in trial logistics and communications regarding the Maxwell trial proceedings.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: SDNY contractor copied on emails regarding press access to trial exhibits and guidance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant on trial, charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity and sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in the crimes for which she is on trial.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse.

persons.name: Eric Blechman
persons.context: Mentioned as having reserved a seat in the courtroom for the trial openings.

persons.name: Damian
persons.context: Mentioned as coming to the courtroom along with Margaret, likely part of the government or legal team.

persons.name: Margaret
persons.context: Mentioned as coming to the courtroom along with Damian, likely part of the government or legal team.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts and sex trafficking.
SDNY staff members coordinating press guidance and trial logistics via email.
Both are points of contact for media regarding trial exhibits and are copied on internal SDNY emails.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal trial of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Opening Statements
events.description: Jury charge followed by opening statements in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell were scheduled for 9:30 a.m. before Judge Alison Nathan.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: Final pretrial conference held in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison Nathan.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell faced six criminal counts including conspiracy to entice minors, transporting minors, and sex trafficking of minors, with maximum prison sentences ranging from 5 to 40 years.
The court granted a government motion allowing several witnesses, including non-victims, to testify under pseudonyms to protect victim identities.
The SDNY press office provided detailed guidance to media, emphasizing policies against identifying sex crime victims without consent.
Government exhibits for the trial were distributed exclusively through an SDNY file share, requiring media to establish access accounts.
